text: Tried the traditional minced meat noodle ($4.50) with abit of chilli. Meepok was al dente and had a good mix of minced pork, mushroom and liver. Overall flavour was tasty. Soup was good but not as hot as I hoped for. Using the NTUC Fairpricr app to pay, a 10% discount is given. Not a big deal.

My kids love the noodles here, which is a great endorsement as they are picky. The noodles are excellent and cooked just right to give it a firm and å¼¹ç‰™ texture. They use freshly made noodles with no hint of alkaline water ç¢±æ°´ which is my yardstick for good noodles. The free bowl of soup is flavourful and shows efforts in the preparation. Worth patronising. Hope you enjoy as much as I do.

Newly open at this capview coffeeshop. Usually see has a constant queue so decide to try it. It not too bad but i find the noodle on the softer side, it just me prefer the more chewy type. If you use the ntuc app to pay is cheaper then using cash
Laksa taste is very inconsistent, recently it's been pretty bland. The laksa has no egg, no prawns, just big fish cake and tau pok and mini non existent cockles. BCM is meh too ðŸ˜ž
